meanings.definition: To lie down or recline on a couch.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, she enjoys couching on the soft sofa.
meanings.sent2: Every evening, he can be found couching in front of the TV.
meanings.sent3: The cat surprised everyone by couching on the dining table.
meanings.sent4: The sun was couching behind the horizon, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The tired hiker dreamt of couching on a bed of soft moss.

meanings.definition: To express something in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She was couching her feelings through her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The poet was couching his emotions in beautiful verses.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was couching his jokes with a serious face.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were couching a deep sadness that words couldn't express.
meanings.sent5: The artist was couching his creativity in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To lower or bend one's head or body in a submissive manner.
meanings.sent1: The dog was couching before its owner, seeking forgiveness.
meanings.sent2: In the presence of the king, the subjects were couching in respect.
meanings.sent3: The student was couching to avoid being called upon by the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The defeated warrior was couching before his conqueror.
meanings.sent5: The cat was couching in apology after knocking over the vase.
